crs2/mdl1/crs2mdl1lsn1.title: What is Reverse Image Search?
crs2/mdl1/crs2mdl1lsn1.description: Welcome to Module 1. In this session, we’ll explore how reverse image search helps us verify what we see online.

crs2/mdl2/crs2mdl2lsn1.title: How to Use Google Reverse Image Search

crs2/mdl3/crs2mdl3lsn1.title: Using keywords + reverse image search together

crs2/mdl3/crs2mdl3lsn2.title: Checking the time filter (when the image first appeared)
crs2/mdl3/crs2mdl3lsn2.description: Click on Tools under the Google Images bar, then select Time. This lets you filter results by date. If you want to know when an image first appeared, look for the earliest date. This is especially useful to detect recycled old photos used as ‘breaking news’.

crs2/mdl3/crs2mdl3lsn3.title: Identifying original sources vs. reposts
crs2/mdl3/crs2mdl3lsn3.description: Not every site using the image is trustworthy. To find the original, check:

crs2/mdl3/crs2mdl3lsn4.title: Looking at similar images for context
crs2/mdl3/crs2mdl3lsn4.description: Google shows visually similar photos. By scanning them, you might find different angles of the same event, or even the unedited version of an image. This helps reveal the full story.

crs2/mdl4/crs2mdl4lsn1.title: Fact-checking news and social media
crs2/mdl4/crs2mdl4lsn1.description: Whenever you see a shocking or unbelievable photo, stop before sharing. Use reverse image search to see if it’s old, edited, or out of context. Often, you’ll find the image has been circulating for years under different claims.

crs2/mdl4/crs2mdl4lsn2.title: Spotting scams (fake profile pictures, product listings)

crs2/mdl4/crs2mdl4lsn3.title: Academic/creative use
crs2/mdl4/crs2mdl4lsn3.description: Students, researchers, and artists also benefit. You can find higher-resolution versions of an image, track whether your work has been reused, or check copyright information to avoid plagiarism.

crs2/mdl5/crs2mdl5lsn1.title: Google’s tool isn’t perfect
crs2/mdl5/crs2mdl5lsn1.description: Welcome to Module 5. We’ve learned how powerful Google Reverse Image Search is, but like all tools, it has limitations.

crs2/mdl6/crs2mdl6lsn1.title: What We Learned
crs2/mdl6/crs2mdl6lsn1.description: We started with the basics—what reverse image search is and why it matters. Then we practiced how to use it step-by-step. We explored advanced tricks like time filters, and we saw how it helps in real-world cases: spotting fake news, scams, and misuse of images. Finally, we learned about the tool’s limitations and alternatives.

crs2/mdl6/crs2mdl6lsn2.title: Quiz
crs2/mdl6/crs2mdl6lsn2.description: Let’s do a quick quiz to test your memory.

crs2/mdl6/crs2mdl6lsn3.title: Wrap-up
crs2/mdl6/crs2mdl6lsn3.description: Reverse image search won’t solve everything, but it gives us a powerful way to fact-check what we see online. The key is to stay curious, think critically, and double-check before sharing.
